attributes.action: Make protesting illegal on Armistice day and Remembrance Sunday
attributes.additional_details:
Any protest designed to or disturb, upset or draw attention to its self for what ever end on Armistice day and /or Remembrance Sunday should be made illegal.
The exceptions to the rule may be examples of established silent protests such as those held by the Greenham women. It would be expected that even in these cases that the protesters portray a sombre and respectful mood with no marches, additional noise or actions on the given days.
